title: You've buffed swain to the point where anyone can use him now at no risk besides throwing
body: Srly, he doesn't even need to scale he can just build w/e and out trade. Let's not even mention he's strong vs ganks considering how his ult works.

His base damages are so insane that he can build tank lol

{{item:3110}} {{item:3001}} {{item:3003}} core

Working as intended.  He was always a tanky battle mage.  He pays for his strengths by being less bursty and less reliable at long range than a lot of mages.
His strengths are spread out, something like:
7/10 tank/sustain
6/10 damage
5/10 reliability/range
5/10 utility/CC
2/10 mobility/invulnerability

Other mages, like let's say {{champion:134}} or {{champion:34}}, would usually be more like:
3/10 tank/sustain
7/10 damage
7/10 reliability/range
6/10 utility/CC
2/10 mobility/invulnerability

Both come out to 25 points in this arbitrary distribution.  In reality, Swain might be slightly overpowered, with like an extra 0.5 points spent somewhere in his power budget.  Riot will probably nerf him if he gets about 3% play rate in any one lane with his current win rate.  Still, it isn't a problem that he's tankier than other mages because it's good to have unique power distributions as long as their total power budget still balances out.

I agree that seems to be swains role but he just does too much damage now before even scaling, so his raw damage needs to be toned down a bit or at least the CD needs to be slightly higher and thank goodness riot is doing that.

If you don't mind, as I main him, I'd like to correct some of your ratings:

-5 tank/sustain, scales up to mid game and then falls off hard: Swain can be bursted, executes shit on him hard, his sustain is relatively reliable but not passive - he can't fight to low HP and then stay in lane solo to heal up
+7/10 his damage can be _a bit_ unreliable and can be built against but he does _a lot_ of damage.
+6/10 his reliability is underestimated though he'll never ever catch a good Zed during an all-in.
+7/10 his utility is higher than Jhin's. Amazing synergy with team, safe too. It is debatable whether he can be a full-fledged support but he sure as hell can go as one without trolling.
2/10 mobility/avoidance - yup. Besides baiting people in with ult he has no real options of escape, even CC has a ton of counterplay.

At the same time, I'd argue that a well played Syndra has reliability rating borderline 9/10, better range, same waveclear, siege range aoe fast stun with melee usability. So yeah, it probably evens out.

PS since this talks about upcoming nerfs I'll give my own 2c: his trades against squishies should probably be nerfed but  here's the thing: he actually really freaking loves Abyssal and it's about to be nerfed heavily. He used to love GLP but now it's meh on him (no HP). So that will nerf him a lot heavier that something like Q CD revert, which is honestly almost unnoticeable either way

None champion should be able to build tanky and still deal a lot of DMG and scale to late at. he same time. This is just bad design enforced by riot to lean towards noobs and casuals to give them everything for free elo.

Don't forget Garen. One Black Cleaver  and he does assassn like damage while still being tanky af because of passive and W. And from there you build pure tank and he's unstoppable without 3 people.

Eh try it out yourself. Most likely the ADC will just lifesteal past your damage.

He does need AP to really do anything.

Whenever I build tanky I feel far less impactful and still seem to die in the same-ish amount of time. Only difference is I don't accomplish anything before death. With a more AP oriented build I'm actually a threat to the backline.

If you even just look at the base numbers they aren't that impressive:

Passive: 105
Q max dmg: 348
W: 300
E: 250
R1 (3 targets): 195/s
R2: 375

Max damage in one combo: 1378 + 195/s

1378 damage isn't gonna do anything to anyone. Maybe you can survive to get an extra 2 Q's off but that's only 698 extra damage.

Now look at it with 400 AP:

Passive: 225
Q max dmg: 732
W: 580
E: 450
R1 (3 targets): ~365/s
R2: 915

Max damage in one combo: 2902 + 365/s

This however will potentially oneshot an ADC, and if it doesn't then the following Q's will still be dealing 732 damage each as opposed to a non-AP pathetic 348.

Altogether that's a 1524 + 170/s damage increase for his burst combo.

Not to mention the heal is pretty lackluster without AP:

Base: 50/s
400 AP: 114/s

Toss in more factors like Void Staff and Morello and AP is doing a hell of a lot more damage.

The tiny radius + insane delay on W made the spell impossible to hit on anyone that uses a mouse to play the game.

You could bodyblock his ult so the AoE damage wasn't exactly AoE but just a nova like Vlad's.

The only real buff that was uncalled for was the 25% cooldown cut off from Q.
This tbh.  Overbuffing completely removes champion skill expression.

We've been testing some nerfs for 8.7, for now it's just reverting the Q buff from 8.5, so increasing the cd by two seconds scaling to the same point at rank 5. Might need to do more yet but that's where we're starting

Swain's E is really obnoxious and really strong, Morgana Q is (was) already the best snare in the game, and you give Swain the same spell and make it AOE, what? it also travels faster and is much harder to see and thus avoid than Morgana Q. and then he also uses his passive to displace you; that sequence of spells makes his E incredibly overloaded for a single spell, and if you want it to be fair, you need to visually communicate what's happening better and add more counterplay so people have a better chance avoiding it or not get punished so harshly when they get hit.

Old Swain also had an AOE snare  but it had a very distinct and telegraphed visual and it didn't double as a displacement, it was fair, this current iteration really isn't.

His E is still really telegraphed and much harder to hit then Morgs Q. Morgana can just Q infront of herself and snare someone for 100%, while Swain has to throw the E out and only the comeback does snare, its incredible easy to doge if you have any mobility

The issue is that without Q Swain has nothing once you do a rotation.   W is on a LONG as CD, E is also long.  That leaves Q and auto attacks and we all know how Immobile mage auto attacks are.

I still wish you guys did something with his Spells that dealt with his Soul stacks.

Like each stack gives his +5% damage and Healing

So you want to fight him with no stacks and you want to avoid him with full stacks.

You lower his damage to Q and E some to compensate for the bonus damage.

Rewards good play (gaining stacks) and makes you think "should I ult now?" because you lose stacks.
